task_description: Facing the building to your East (approx. 85°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full height of the building to estimate it, so I will start by looking up to find the roof.
My heading has unexpectedly changed to 0° North, so I need to rotate back to the East (approximately 85°) to face the target building again.
I am now facing the correct building again, so I will look up to see the top of the building to estimate its full height.
The system has reset my heading to 0° North again; I need to rotate back to face the building at 85° East and simultaneously look up to see the roof.
I can now see the top of the building and I will look down to see the base to get a full view before making my final estimation.
The heading has reset again; I need to rotate back to 85° East and look down at -30° to see the base of the building, which will give me the final view needed for my estimation.

I have now viewed the building from top to bottom; the ground floor appears to be about 6 meters high, with five additional floors of approximately 3 meters each, plus a roof structure, leading to an estimated total height of around 24 meters.
